name: places/ChIJw5PYjDa5woARqbLzycJtjo8
formattedAddress: 40 E 19th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 40 E 19th St, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text:
BEWARE! They really deserve 0 stars. I am an interior designer in NYC in business for 13 years. This company is definitely the worst I have ever worked with. They are deceitful in so many ways. I ordered a custom bed, 2 dressers, 4 nightstands and a custom sofa from them for a project. They delivered everything 2 months later than quoted. The delivery guys then screwed the leg on top of a nightstand, ruining it. We waited another 3 months for the replacement, the paint job was bad and they put the wrong legs on. They came back to install the correct legs, but never replaced the piece when they said they would. The sofa arrived with the seat cushion 2” short on both sides, it was very noticeable. They remade the cushion for us, but it was exactly the same even after they came to take a template. When followed up with they never came back to fix it and stopped any correspondence. The managers (plural because they can’t keep their employees) will say they are answering for the owner, then when you ask to speak to anyone higher up, you have to call the offices in Los Angeles (they often do not answer), you will then speak with a “Nancy,” she will get nothing done or reply to you and won’t let you speak to the owners. Ultimately my client filed a lawsuit in NYC and won.

This company is owned by and employed with liars and thieves. Once they have your money, you are at their mercy and be ready for nothing but headaches and a lot of frustrating back and forth that results in nothing being fixed and damaged goods. They also will not refund you anything unless maybe you keep the piece as is for a discount.

I will never shop with them again and you should not either. BEWARE.

originalText.text:
BUYER BEWARE! Do not order from this company! You will be sorry!! Mark my words; you've been warned.

I waited 8.5 months for my (very expensive) bed, 8.5 months! That is egregious enough. What is even more egregious is during my entire saga with this company, I didn't receive one apology for my troubles or one single email update (I had to ask for an update every time). If the staff had acknowledged the mistake and took steps to make me a satisfied customer, I would not bother leaving this review. For the price I paid for this bed, I expect a top notch experience from start to finish - not a total mess.

I ordered the bed late Feb 2023. The factory had a mix up, and in late August (when the bed was already 6 weeks late), the fabric was not what I ordered. So they had to remake it. Again, not one apology for the inconvenience, not one offer to refund my shipping costs at least, and definitely not one email update from them. Instead, I was treated like a burden every time I asked for an update. They would respond with one word answers or not at all. The cherry on top of the cake is when this bed was finally, finally ready, they tried to deliver it on a date I explicitly told them via email I was out of town. Then when they did deliver, it was past the delivery window and I was late to an important meeting. Side note: the delivery staff were very nice and professional (both times hah).

In speaking with the staff, it's clear that things like this happen all the time for Mod Shop. They didn't bother to apologize or keep me updated because this is business as usual for this company. And the pandemic is no excuse - you can see their bad reviews go back 5 or 6 years. Is it a beautiful bed? Yes. Was this in any way worth the time, money and frustration? Not in the least. I will never ever be ordering from this company again, and will in fact be telling all of my friends and family (including on social media) that this place is to be avoided like the plague.

originalText.text: We bought our sofa less than a year ago and one of our cushion INSERTS needs to be replaced due to a senior cat accident. Edwin reported that the higher ups want to charge us $700 for a replacement piece of foam and some feathers. What a scam. I was willing to pay like $200 for the replacement, considering we paid $2300 for the sofa. Terrible way to treat your customers.

text.text: We bought our sofa less than a year ago and one of our cushion INSERTS needs to be replaced due to a senior cat accident. Edwin reported that the higher ups want to charge us $700 for a replacement piece of foam and some feathers. What a scam. I was willing to pay like $200 for the replacement, considering we paid $2300 for the sofa. Terrible way to treat your customers.

originalText.text: The showroom is beautifully set up, with a welcoming atmosphere. I couldn’t be happier with the ModShop team that helped us talk through the overall aesthetic of our home, and patiently sorted through various swatches. Delivery was extremely convenient, and the ModShop team made sure we were kept up to date the entire time. We absolutely love our sectional and credenza, and are constantly getting compliments on them! Festa has a great eye for design and was so helpful in helping us map out what would fit in our space.

originalText.text: Great quality furniture. Took a while to arrive but definitely worth the wait. I will buy again and again.
